meanings.definition: A group of diapsid reptiles that includes dinosaurs, birds, and crocodilians.
meanings.sent1: Archosaurs lived during the time of dinosaurs.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the fossils of archosaurs to learn about prehistoric creatures.
meanings.sent3: The archosaurs had a party and invited all their dinosaur friends.
meanings.sent4: In the museum, the skeleton of the archosaurs stood tall like a guardian of the past.
meanings.sent5: The children were amazed by the size and strength of the archosaurs in the exhibit.

meanings.sent1: The archosaurs basked in the sun to warm their cold-blooded bodies.
meanings.sent2: The zoo had a special exhibit featuring a live archosaur for visitors to see.
meanings.sent3: The archosaur decided to take a nap under the shade of a tree.
meanings.sent4: The archosaur moved gracefully through the water, like a prehistoric ballet dancer.
meanings.sent5: Children at the zoo squealed with delight when they saw the archosaur up close.

meanings.sent1: The toy dinosaur had an archosaur look with its sharp teeth and long tail.
meanings.sent2: The artist created a painting of an archosaur landscape with towering trees and ancient creatures.
meanings.sent3: The archosaur costume for Halloween was a big hit at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her movements were swift and powerful, like that of an archosaur on the hunt.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit featured lifelike sculptures of archosaur creatures from the past.
